item.title: Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:14, topic:280616”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=370623.msg2801114#msg2801114 date=1243441649]

IMO lighttpd uses far less resources…

Show me a decent replacement for .htaccess files and I would be more than glad to do so.
[/quote]http://diaryproducts.net/about/web_servers/lighttpd/htaccess_lighttpd[/quote]

That kind of stretches the word ‘decent’, I might have a go at it on the server I have here at home though and see what happens, thanks.

Read full topic

item.description:

IMO lighttpd uses far less resources…
[/quote]

Show me a decent replacement for .htaccess files and I would be more than glad to do so.[/quote]http://diaryproducts.net/about/web_servers/lighttpd/htaccess_lighttpd

item.title: Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:280616”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=370623.msg2801662#msg2801662 date=1243470356]
Ugh, this once happened to one of my old smf sites, and someone downloaded the settings file and got my db password. Ofc, I was a fucktard then, but it wasn’t pretty. Might want to be a little weary of that Mopar.
[/quote]

Yea, any decent server will only allow them to download the output.

Not to mention that I could post my Settings.php out in the open and no one could do anything with it, MySQL only listens on localhost, and so is not accessible outside of the server no matter what info you have.[/quote]

Different situation then, and it wasn’t a great webserver.

[quote=“jme, post:11, topic:280616”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=370623.msg2801662#msg2801662 date=1243470356]
Ugh, this once happened to one of my old smf sites, and someone downloaded the settings file and got my db password. Ofc, I was a fucktard then, but it wasn’t pretty. Might want to be a little weary of that Mopar.
[/quote]

Like eczema3 said, it would have just been the html output. It’s like right clicking http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php and clicking save target as/save link as[/quote]

Yeah, I see what you mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Taharok:

Ugh, this once happened to one of my old smf sites, and someone downloaded the settings file and got my db password. Ofc, I was a fucktard then, but it wasn’t pretty. Might want to be a little weary of that Mopar.

Yea, any decent server will only allow them to download the output.

Not to mention that I could post my Settings.php out in the open and no one could do anything with it, MySQL only listens on localhost, and so is not accessible outside of the server no matter what info you have.

Read full topic

item.title: Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Ugh, this once happened to one of my old smf sites, and someone downloaded the settings file and got my db password. Ofc, I was a fucktard then, but it wasn’t pretty. Might want to be a little weary of that Mopar.

Like eczema3 said, it would have just been the html output. It’s like right clicking http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php and clicking save target as/save link as

item.title: Wtf?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

They couldn’t have downloaded the settings file, unless it was stored as plain text and not a PHP file, because if you get into the scenario that lordbost was in, if he had downloaded the fle he would have just got the HTML output.
